bibl.title: Mandulis Apollo's Diplomacy. Echoes of Greek Culture and Hellenism at Talmis (Nubia) in the Roman Period.
Greco-Egyptian Interactions. Literature, Translation, and Culture, 500 BCE - 300 CE.

bibl.note: Features of hellenism [considers in part. I. métriques 166]: 1. Greek language and literary traditions; - 2. A corpus of Greco-Roman myths and images; - 3. Greco-Roman rituals and practices. - Egyptian culture: 1. Egyptian theology; - 2. Egyptian ritual; - 3. Egyptian literary traditions. - Interpretatio Graeca. - Bridging the two worlds.
bibl.seg: Gaëlle Tallet, Mandulis Apollo's Diplomacy. Echoes of Greek Culture and Hellenism at Talmis (Nubia) in the Roman Period.
Ian Rutherford (ed.), Greco-Egyptian Interactions. Literature, Translation, and Culture, 500 BCE - 300 CE (Oxford, 2016) pp. 287-315, 7 figg.

Features of hellenism [considers in part. I. métriques 166]: 1. Greek language and literary traditions; - 2. A corpus of Greco-Roman myths and images; - 3. Greco-Roman rituals and practices. - Egyptian culture: 1. Egyptian theology; - 2. Egyptian ritual; - 3. Egyptian literary traditions. - Interpretatio Graeca. - Bridging the two worlds.
